name: Tutor House
slogan: High quality tutition that is globally accessible
description: We are an Education Technology that offers a tailored service to ensure our tutors are best matched to meet the needs of the client.

jobs.title: Client Assistant
jobs.description:
Who we’re looking for:

We're looking for someone who loves helping people. If you love interacting with people on a daily basis to help them understand how to use technology and to help get the most out of their education, then read on…

About you:

- You're empathetic to customers (parents, students and tutors) and can easily put yourself in their shoes. You make customers feel empowered after interacting with them: not stupid because of a small mistake or oversight. You obsess over the details.

- You love solving problems. Every customer is different and every problem is unique to them. You thrive on being able to meet their specific needs, and solve their problems in the best way possible.

- You can see the bigger picture. The support team at Tutor House are different to many online companies. We don’t outsource our support to a 3rd party. We work hard as a team to make sure all customers are happy.

We’re growing at a fast rate, so there’s always a new feature around the corner. There’s always a solution to a problem that a customer is facing right now - but we’re probably working on something that means their life will be even easier and even more exciting in the months to come. Being aware of the product releases will mean you can not only solve problems in the present, but also paint a picture of what the future holds - informing and inspiring customers and inviting them onto our journey at the same time.

At Tutor House, we have team meetings each week and then we go and make things happen. Your ideas are valued and taken onboard. You’ll love working in a team but also be independent and able to set your own goals.

Things you might do:

Tutor House is a fast-growing company and we’ve reached a stage where we really want to get to know all of our customers, old and new, on a deeper level. So, you’ll be responsible for reaching out to our community and supporting them whatever stage they’re at.

You can expect to:

- Work as part of the Client support team and alongside the Tutor support team to improve customer happiness and retention
- Reach out to our existing database of parents and students to establish relationships and provide support.
- Help customers via email, chat or phone to ensure they have the best experience possible.
- Write documentation to help users navigate the website
- Work closely with the client and tutor support team and come up with ideas and growth strategies

The package:

Location: Leicester Square, London
Compensation: £18,000 to £22,000
Time: Work 5 days per week, 45 hours per week
Bonus: Team and individual bonuses
Progression: you will join Tutor House as one of the first 15 people, and so there is high potential of quick career progression to a management role in 1-3 years.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: £18,000.00 to £22,000.00 /year

jobs.title: Recruitment Manager
jobs.description:
About Tutor House:

Voted best start up in 2019, Tutor House is well on it’s way to changing education, Tutor House is the UK's leading private tuition platform. We believe everyone should have access to a personalised education that promotes both academic growth and personal development. With thousands of lessons taking place on a daily basis, we’re looking to expand our community.

What we’re looking for:

Tutor House is seeking a highly skilled and experienced Recruitment Manager for both UK on-boarding and growth. Reporting to the Director of Sales. And working closely with the CMO and CEO, you’ll ideally need a minimum of 2 years experience. A very good communicator, a leader and an individual with a brilliant phone and email manner. We’d expect you to work under pressure and work hard to meet key targets.

Responsibilities:

    Be responsible for growing and engaging the tutor and customer community
    Grow our current tutor database by working with tutors and teachers, setting up events, running our learning hubs and being accountable for sign ups and booking.
    Manage existing tutors, ensuring they are fully engaged with our brand and site
    Manage the tutor onboarding live chat and respond promptly to tutors during working hours
    Be the main point of contact for tutors, responding to all enquiries and developing strong relationships that promote retention and loyalty
    Liaise with department head to work on marketing strategies to provide a constant stream of tutor sign-ups and ideas to improve tutor engagement
    Work with a commercial mindset - always aiming to improve tutor and customer retention and propose ideas to continually improve and grow the business
    Assist the CFO and financial advisors on all budgeting and forecasts
    Undertake management of all key accounts
    Present Budgeting and Forecasting to DOG and CEO, monthly
    Check all tutors have been paid on time and monitor delays
    Devise monthly reports for management accounts
    Work with all teams to reduce bottlenecks and road blocks
    Work with all teams to ensure new roadmaps and targets are met
    Administrative and time management skills and ability to continually learn.

Key skills we’re after:

Leadership

Collaboration

Analytical

Highly experienced using Office (Excel and Word)

Salary:

£22-28,000

Grow our current tutor database by working with tutors and teachers, setting up events, running our learning hubs and being accountable for sign ups and booking.
Manage existing tutors, ensuring they are fully engaged with our brand and site

Check all tutors have been paid on time and monitor delays
Devise monthly reports for management accounts
Work with all teams to reduce bottlenecks and road blocks
Work with all teams to ensure new roadmaps and targets are met
Administrative and time management skills and ability to continually learn.

Highly experienced using Office (Excel and Word)

£22-28,000
